author: Reid J. Epstein
title: Pennsylvania’s Special House Race Is Trial Run for Midterm Strategies
text:
Democrat Conor Lamb clung to a razor-thin lead in Pennsylvania’s special election for a U.S. House seat Wednesday morning, as absentee ballots were tallied. Republican Rick Saccone said he wouldn’t concede until election officials finished the count.
Mr. Lamb’s margin was so tight that the count carried into Wednesday, but it was an achievement for the Democrats in a district that President Donald Trump won in 2016 by 20 percentage points.
... RELATED VIDEO Can the Democrats Ride a Blue Wave to Midterm Election Wins? The Democrats have a "blue wave" of momentum building for the 2018 midterms, thanks to a motivated base, success in special elections and a low approval rating for President Trump. Will that be enough to take back the House and the Senate?
